related_issues.title: Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
related_issues.text:
Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension, VS Code, Sharing Web App

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.12

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I've been unable to generate shareable personal links and utilize the web sharing app since before June '24. I've created an issue about this twice before, and the last time was just completely disregarded and it was closed out.

Here is the screenshot from within my Pieces Desktop when trying to generate a personal link, as well as generate a GitHub Gist:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0966a1a9-3076-4d9b-9006-88a14673cc9f)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Shareable links feature was malfunctioning for some users.
* The issue was attributed to outdated infrastructure powering the feature.

**Problems Identified:**

* Shareable links were failing for some users.
* Generating a GitHub Gist was not working for one user.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a developer at Pieces, proposed a meeting with the affected user to diagnose the issue and provide updates on the roadmap for the feature.
* Several patches were implemented to address the stability of the feature.
* A major upgrade to the infrastructure powering the feature was planned for December 2024.
* A new version of Pieces OS (v11.0.3) was released in January 2025 with further improvements.
* A v2 of the shareable links feature was being scoped to address ongoing issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue reported by tombinga in November 2024 appears to have been resolved.
* However, a new issue with generating GitHub Gists was reported in January 2025. 
* This issue is being addressed in a separate thread.
* The v2 of the shareable links feature is still under development and expected to be released sometime after December 2025.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue with outdated infrastructure was resolved with the release of Pieces OS v10.1.13 on November 19-21st, 2024.
* Users experiencing issues after this update were encouraged to reach out to Mark for further assistance.
* The issue with generating GitHub Gists is currently being investigated by the Pieces team.
* Users experiencing this issue are encouraged to file a new issue and provide the requested information for troubleshooting.

This summary highlights the key points of the conversation, focusing on the most important details. It also provides a timeline of the events and the current status of the issue.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* High CPU usage with LTM2 enabled, particularly affecting Microsoft Edge and Discord.
* The issue persisted across different hardware and Windows versions.
* The issue appeared resolved for some users after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM2 caused significant CPU usage spikes, impacting performance.
* The issue particularly affected certain applications like Microsoft Edge and Discord.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Several hotfix updates were released to address the issue.
* Users were advised to update Microsoft Edge and WebView2.
* LTM2 was further optimized to improve its impact on CPU usage.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be largely resolved with the release of PiecesOS v11.2.3, which includes significant LTM2 optimizations.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest version for optimal performance.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users reported success with temporarily disabling and re-enabling LTM2.
* Moving application folders to ReFS drives and creating symbolic links may also improve performance.

**Overall:**

PiecesOS developers actively addressed the LTM2 CPU usage issue and released updates to improve the situation. While some users may still experience occasional spikes, the problem appears largely resolved with the latest version.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## Conversation Summary: 

**Key Points:**

* User @uwascan reported an issue with their Pieces OS.
* @uwascan's issue involved a Trojan attack mentioned in Issues 653, 654, and 627.

**Problems Identified:**

* Multiple users, including @uwascan, were experiencing problems with their Pieces OS due to antivirus software.
* @crimso reported Malwerbytes and Nod32 blocking access to the official Pieces website and deleting update files.
* @merlauz reported ESET Antivirus causing similar problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @nathan-courtney-pieces suggested configuring Kaspersky to allow Pieces OS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It's unclear if @crimso's and @merlauz's issues were addressed.
* It's also unknown whether a fix for antivirus conflict issues was planned or implemented.

**Additional Notes:**

* The provided conversation only offers a brief glimpse of the problem. 
* More information from @uwascan, @crimso, @merlauz, or Pieces support team members would be necessary for a complete understanding of the issue and its resolution.

related_issues.text:
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e730898-a168-4571-ab0d-6331c4d389a4)

i want stop but its not working 

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** Users report the "Stop Download" button not working for the Mistral 8 7B model, leading to stuck initialization and download processes.

**Key points raised:**

* Issue confirmed by other users (AkhilTrivediX, jaybuidl).
* Initializing and completing downloads work as expected.
* Model deletion and activation work correctly.
* Issue specific to Mistral 8 7B model.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* **Temporary fix:** Delete all files from C:\Users\[YOUR-USERNAME]\Documents\com.pieces.os\ and reinstall Pieces OS and desktop app.
* **Others attempted fixes (unsuccessful):**
    * Reinstalling without data deletion.
    * Reinstalling Ollama.
    * Disconnecting internet.
    * Restarting machine.
* Local Large Language Model stack currently undergoing infrastructure upgrade and replacement, planned to be in production within 2-3 weeks (as of Nov 18, 2024).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue persists, affecting Mistral 8 7B model download on Windows and macOS devices.
* Temporary solution available but requires data deletion and reinstallation.
* Long-term fix expected with upcoming stack infrastructure update.

**Further Actions:**

* Monitor the stack update progress and test for issue resolution after implementation.
* Update the GitHub issue with the fixed status if successful. 
* Consider revising documentation if necessary.
